availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Gilbert (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and butcher)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and butcher. Kentucky native. Married to Julia Anne Hall Gilbert in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on June 21,1847. Father of John H. Gilbert, Anna Gilbert, Sophia Gilbert, Albert Gilbert, and Charles Gilbert. Farmer in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer and butcher in Fayette County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Farmer in Fayette County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 589.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 436B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 4, p. 103B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Fayette County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 8.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film 000183145.
